website_summaries.verdict: An affordable choice for casual users and those who want to experience kayaking on calmer waters. Roomy enough for 2 adults and gear; inflates in 15 minutes.
pros: Basic paddles and air pump included
Good stability during boarding and exiting
cons: Not suitable for white-water kayaking or other advanced uses
Skeg has a tendency to break off

customer_reviews.title: So much fun!
customer_reviews.text: I love this kayak! You can go swimming in the middle of the lake. Re-entering is easy and it won't flip. When you remove both seats 2 people can comfortably sit on inflated floor facing each other and enjoy lazy afternoon on the water. You can also buy kayak anchor and enjoy sunshine without a drift.
customer_reviews.author: Sceptic Jim

customer_reviews.title: With a few additions this kayak will be a blast!
customer_reviews.text: A genuinely usable intro to the world of kayaking. I would upgrade the paddles for a more comfortable grip. Also, I improvised a semi-official solution to the lost-skeg problem by using a Go-Pro tethering system (search GoPro Surf Mount) to keep the skeg from getting lost once disconnected. See photo.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce K.

customer_reviews.title: Air Pump is not covered under warranty
customer_reviews.text: I received a Kayak with no SKEG which is covered under warranty and Intex agreed to replace however after first use with the kayak the pump handle came out of the pump causing it to be unusable. I call Intex for warranty since it is within 90 day period and they said the pump is not covered under warranty. The kayaks are decent but accessories are not good which may influence your decision whether not purchase this item.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Morrison

customer_reviews.title: Description is NOT accurate - this is the older Intex Explorer, not the newer, updated Explorer K2
customer_reviews.text: This listing explicitly states that this item is the Intex Explorer K2, but that is not what I received. Instead, I received the older Intex Explorer that was updated and replaced by the Explorer K2. Both boats are shown in the pictures, but the listing states that this should be the K2. Be aware before ordering that what was advertised may not be what you will receive.
customer_reviews.author: Vixen

customer_reviews.title: Cheaply made, you get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: This was a great kayak until it wasn't. I've my first one in June, and there was a leak the very first time I took it out. The return was so easy, that I stayed hopeful that was just a fluke and got a replacement. The replacement kayak was great for about 2 months, and I thoroughly enjoyed taking it out. I probably took it out 12 or so times total. Yesterday I blew it up and noticed another leak in the middle compartment. It wasn't even on the bottom, where there would have been a possibility of being snagged on a rock or something. This is an incredibly poorly made kayak. you get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Holes Upon Opening
customer_reviews.text: My kids got these for Christmas. We live in the Midwest so our first opportunity to use them was Memorial Day weekend. They were stored in their original boxes, never opened. Upon opening and inflating the kayak, we found two small pinholes that were leaking quite a bit of air. We followed the instructions with the patch kit to repair the holes. The patch kit did not work and air was deflated within a few minutes. Neither Amazon nor Intex will provide any resolution since we ordered the product more than 90 days ago. I would have expected better quality for the price we paid. Very disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Andrea I. Majors

customer_reviews.title: Just buy a real one or you will regret this purchase. :(
customer_reviews.text: We purchased 2 of these. We only used them twice. One scraped an oyster bar and put a small hole in the bottom. No big deal didn’t really effect it. The other one on the got a random hole in the side no clue how! We were very far out, nothing near us and in deep waters in the Tampa Bay. It was very hard to get back to land. Flimsy trash! Now for tracking... Just No! it is not a kayak. It’s a Banana shaped raft with paddles. You have to continually paddle or it turns and stops. It is exhausting. Save your money and buy a real kayak! I wish we had done it.
customer_reviews.author: Dena

customer_reviews.title: Fun but not reliable and neither durable
customer_reviews.text: We try it first time in a lake and it was good. Pretty easy to inflate. This weekend we went again, one of the sides start losing air. Looks like it was punched with something we were far away from the shore and i need to inflate that side with my mouth in order to arrive. It is fun for swimming pools and placed were you are sure won’t hit any tree or rock. I dont remember hitting any rock or tree i think it got punched while i was inflating outside. If you plan to do this more often save and get you a real one
customer_reviews.author: Ana L.

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: I was hoping it would be this good. It was very durable material and surprisingly, the oars are great quality. I went out once and forgot the fin so don't forget that, it's much harder to navigate without it. It doesn't take on any water and even has a drain hole on one end just in case. My friend has the challenger and says the bottom is not inflatable like the expedition is and she takes on tons of water because it's so low to the water. She loved this one because you're up out of the water. Even my dog enjoyed the ride. Great price for a great product.
customer_reviews.author: Gabrielle Brugato

customer_reviews.title: Don’t waste your money
customer_reviews.text: I feel like all the reviews for this lied. Tried this kayak out at a place I’ve been to before and is very smooth, calming water. This kayak was horrible. Easy enough to get in and out of but it was so sensitive that I was putting all my effort into trying to get it to stay straight. While everyone else was easily making their way this thing just wanted to go left or right, never straight. Couldn’t even stop and rest because it would just spin. I will definitely be investing in a new kayak.
customer_reviews.author: Ariel

customer_reviews.title: Whatever Floats you’re Boat.
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a two person Kayak for my wife and I. We have a couple small ponds and Reservoir. I didn’t want to spend $800. for a big hard plastic one since we would be using it occasionally. This took 10 mins to blow up with the Air Pump that comes with it. So we can take it on trips and camping. I’m very pleased with it and don’t have any regrets buying it. Wasn’t even $80 vs $800 for endless fun.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony J.

customer_reviews.title: Flat after 30 minutes.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my son as a Christmas present thinking we could use it this summer. The weather was finally nice enough this weekend to try it. We were on it for maybe 30 minutes and the left side started losing air. I thought maybe the valve came unscrewed so I filled it with air again but it was flat by the next morning. Unfortunately, I can’t return since we bought it in a December. I wouldn’t recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Neen

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Inflatable Kayak
customer_reviews.text: When I got the kayak I immediately took it to the lake. I was excited, but nervous that it wouldn't meet my expectations. Yet it exceeded them. My dogs were able to craw around, there was enough room for two. It was very sturdy and did not give at all. We got around the lake with no problems and really enjoyed it. Great buy. Excited to show this thing off this summer. Thanks intex!
customer_reviews.author: Anthony C.

customer_reviews.title: Arrived with hole
customer_reviews.text: Ordered three intex inflatables for Lake Trip this year. two of them performed great and I've left great reviews. This one was the highest quality and most expensive of the three and arrived with a large hole in the underside. Box was in good condition. I ordered these early for the trip and didn't unbox them because I didn't want to take any chances. My advice is open these when you get them and try them out of you want any chance of returning them...then transfer to a tote or something $80 down the drain. I'd be happy to change this review if intex or amazon resolves this issue.
customer_reviews.author: Mark J. Bates

customer_reviews.title: A Much Better Kayak Than Expected
customer_reviews.text: My wife and I plan on taking this to Florida this winter and wanted to test it out before we took it with us. We have ocean going kayaks, but they are heavy and must be carted on the roof so we were considering taking this kayak instead. We were expecting it to be difficult to inflate, but the little hand pump worked quickly and efficiently. We expected the paddles to be cheap and shabby but they were sturdy and easy to assemble and disassemble. We took it out into a lake and had a great time. It was comfortable and sturdy enough to make us feel safe in aligator territory .
customer_reviews.author: Rick

customer_reviews.title: Nice kayaks.  Can't beat the price.
customer_reviews.text: We have a big family so we bought four. Can fit everyone AND the kayaks into the minivan, no trailer need and nothing needs to go on the roof. Have bottomed out plenty of times and still have not punctured one. Just DO NOT INFLATE in full sunlight because it will soften the pvc and cause it to stretch. Happened to one of ours but it is still usable. Check on price at least once in the morning and once in the evening for a full week and you should be able to get them for 80 instead of 130
customer_reviews.author: Andrew C. Steitz

customer_reviews.title: hole developed on first use
customer_reviews.text: We bought this hoping it would be easier to haul around than the rigid kayaks. The first time we attempted to use it the bottom chamber leaked. I assume it didn’t come this way but it wasn’t abused, we did nothing that we would have expected to cause a tear. We pumped it up in a garage and hauled to the water, where we noticed it was losing air from a small hole on the bottom. I’m disappointed in the quality and would not recommend. We didn’t even get to use it once.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa

customer_reviews.title: bought a new kayak received a used one
customer_reviews.text: I bought this going with all the nice reviews on this kayak , bought it as a new item , what I received was a heavily used kayak full of leaves , mud , old gum and something else i am not sure about what it is . I am very disappointed . Did not open the box until i was at the lake ( 2 hours away from my house ) , I was being stupid and should have not trusted that i had a new kayak and opened it at home .
customer_reviews.author: Nicole Laskin

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy
customer_reviews.text: This kayak defintely exceeded my expectations. I bought this kayak for a month long road trip I was doing in the PNW. For the price I expected a flimsy flotation device, but this kayak is sturdy and withstood all sorts of abuse. We took it in both lakes and rivers, and we're very happy with its performance. There's tons of space, the seats are comfortable, and it inflates in just a few minutes. My only complaint would be that a small amount of water did somehow get inside one of the side air compartments and I'm worried that may mildew over time. But overall totally worth it for my trip, and I look forward to many more uses.
customer_reviews.author: gina

customer_reviews.title: Leak after the SECOND time on LAKE
customer_reviews.text: Hi, Intex, I got a leak the 2nd time I took this out on the water. I tried to repair it with your patch kit before the 3rd time out on the lake and it began to leak while I was out on the water. The season is upon us and I saw the kayak in the closet and I am really bummed. IS there anyway Intex will replace my kayak without me having bought the warranty? Hoping
customer_reviews.author: Tupac987654321

customer_reviews.title: except the patch kit that come with it is so poor. The glue let the patch simply slide off ...
customer_reviews.text: Okay, so it's inflatable and it punctured. First use. But I still would have rated it higher, except the patch kit that come with it is so poor. The glue let the patch simply slide off on the second use. Wasted money. likes: Fairly easy to inflate, more than one major air chamber. dislikes: Very difficult to keep to pressure (even when not punctured) resulting in poor maneuverability and drag. Nothing like even a mediocre non-inflatable kayak
customer_reviews.author: Steve Lowther

customer_reviews.title: No customer service...
customer_reviews.text: I was really excited to get this product after buying it. Unfortunately there is a huge forklift? Hole in the box that pierced the kayak. A call to the 800 number ended when their system kicked me off. Doesn't give me the option to replace, only for refund. I want my kayak! So frustrating! the review will only let me post if I pick Stars. I did not inflate this kayak. Just had to choose stars to post.
customer_reviews.author: Chris C.

customer_reviews.title: the pump broke and I could not contact seller
customer_reviews.text: I hate to write this review because we love the boat. But the pump broke on first use. I tried contacting the number provided in the Questions section (1-800-234-6839) and on the website but the call got disconnected after a long automated message saying how busy the people are and website information. Please reach out to us and let us know how we can get the pump replaced because I also bought the product warranty when I bought this boat. We love it but are unable to use it which is so very disappointing. :(
customer_reviews.author: rakshya dhungel

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: We finally got the chance to take it out to the reservoir last weekend and it was great! Good space for two with room for supplies (drinks/lunch/towels). We were out on the water for about 6 hours and it didn't loose much air even in the 105 degree heat. Comfortable and the adjustable seats were awesome. Bonus, everything fit into the storage bag easily at the end of the day. Bag is 25Lx22Hx11W inches
customer_reviews.author: Sue

customer_reviews.title: Poor design and poor quality materials
customer_reviews.text: This Intex inflatable Kayak is of very poor design and quality, takes a long time and a lot of work to inflate, and takes on a considerable amount of water. The storage bag that comes with it ripped and so did the carry strap the first time I used it. It was missing two of the paddle water stops. I only used it twice but it started to leak air on the second use so in the trash it goes. Stay clear of this product and don't waste your money.
customer_reviews.author: Do it right the first time

customer_reviews.title: Happy with purchase.
customer_reviews.text: Good watercraft for a lake or easy going river. Got 2 so my wife and I can have our own and split the gear between us and the dog in one. Also allows us to lay back and relax (see pic) when we want to. The only reason I gave 4 stars is that with just one person paddling, even with the skeg, it doesn't track all that well. It's not terrible but there is a lot of back and forth which each stroke. I would definitely recommend this for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Not for me
customer_reviews.text: I did not like this kayak it is more like a canoe you sit in. It was heavy and a pain to inflate. Then I got it in the water and I had a HOLE! Right out of the box. Item was returned, but I had to pay to reshelf. Whatever at least I wasn't out the whole price of the kayak. I bought a different one by sevylor and it is MUCH better!
customer_reviews.author: Melissa Hackett

customer_reviews.title: Amazing raft at an even better price
customer_reviews.text: Just took it out for the first spin. Was really easy to inflate but the inflator could be a little more sturdy. It came apart a couple of times when inflating really fast but was easily screwed back on. The Pro's inflator is like a bike pump, so you can use both hands and stand up while inflating. This one is for one arm only. But for me it wasn't a big deal. Still inflated quickly. Good quality.
customer_reviews.author: Gerardo A. Cabral

customer_reviews.title: Awesome, Fun, Fairly Durable
customer_reviews.text: Used it this weekend. Was awesome. Medium thickness. Much better than a floating toy, but not quite like a river raft either. Would likely take some impacts, so long as they aren't too sharp. I imagine it will last a long time playing on the lakes reservoirs I got it for. I also grabbed a DC plug pump to help inflate it faster. Hand pump worked well, though it's fairly lightweight. If you think you are buying an expensive high quality kayak, you are kidding yourself. If you think you are buying a toy - it's much better than expected. Would buy another, would recommend. My friends that used it this weekend were all saying they should get one too.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Everything will break or rip in less than 10 trips
customer_reviews.text: Carrying bag it comes with is awful it ripped on first day. The pump broke during second day. Kayak is pretty damn slow but manageable on calm small ponds. It’s only been two months and the seam ripped in the middle of the lake on one chamber.... panic moment as I struggle to paddle shore as it was blowing air out... I’ve had other intex boats before and this one is the worst one I’ve used. Save money and buy a different one. Two stars because I did have fun while it worked and it’s cheap price
customer_reviews.author: ICEbulrae

customer_reviews.title: Decent Inflatable kayak
customer_reviews.text: Quick to inflate, it takes 10 minutes. It is good on calm water and fits in the truck of my car easy. However, the skeg fell off after 3 day of using it. I tried ordering it off their website but it is unavailable and their support line was busy for a week. You can technically stilling use the kayak without the skeg but it is very noticeable and it is wobbly. The seats and paddles are alright. Edited: The kayak got a puncture hole on the front. I am so sad. I was hoping this kayak was going to last longer.
customer_reviews.author: Jo

customer_reviews.title: great inflatable option
customer_reviews.text: I use this for just one person and it works great. Lots of room to stretch out and very light. I can handle it by myself. Couple of things if you are thinking of buying: more difficult to paddle because the inflatable tubes mean you have to extend your arms more than on a regular plastic kayak. Also, the paddle will drip in your kayak. Because you need to extend past the pontoons, the paddle need to be much longer to avoid drips down the handle onto you and in the kayak. I still like it a lot though.
customer_reviews.author: customer

customer_reviews.title: One Major Design Flaw
customer_reviews.text: This is a fine product for its price with one HUGE design flaw. There is a sharp seam that runs all across the top of both sides of the boat so every time you row you fingers or thumbs come down on/across that seam. It's annoying and a bit painful after a while. I took this kayak on a trip to the Great Lakes to try it out and the window of return had closed by the time I returned. Was hoping to trade up for something similar without the seam!
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Newell

customer_reviews.title: Too cumbersome to use and travel with
customer_reviews.text: We inflated this kayak in our living room, but never put it in water, can't comment on it's actual use. It seemed to be quite good, everything it was described to be. But for us, planning a car trip to Mexico, it was too large and heavy, time-consuming to inflate and too difficult to deflate, just not practical for us. If we were staying in one place and didn't have to inflate/deflate and pack it up all the time we would have kept it. Seems like a very good value, love the concept.
customer_reviews.author: Mary McNellis

customer_reviews.title: Great fun
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for the kids at the lake and they mocked me for buying it instead of a hard-bodied kayak but they all agreed after they took it out on the lake that it was a lot of fun. Videos online show people using this as a serious kayak but we just used it to putz around the lake. We have only used it once so I can't attest to its durability. It seems to be of good quality so I am optimistic that if we take good care of it, it will last for many summers.
customer_reviews.author: scoopace

customer_reviews.title: Horrible experience
customer_reviews.text: first one got a hole after the first use. They replaced it with a second one and we took it out just now for the first time to pump it up and it had a hole.
customer_reviews.author: Lesa

customer_reviews.title: Great Kayak.
customer_reviews.text: Bought 2 of these and received them yesterday, I'm hoping to use these to replace our long 16 ft canoe. So far I'm very impressed, packaging was very good and protected everything, easy to inflate with the pump it comes with (took me about 5 mins each). I left them inflated overnight and they held air fine. I'm 6 foot tall and there is plenty of room for me in the front or back seat of these, the material seems very heavy duty. These are very hard to beat for the price. I have not taken them on the water yet but I cannot see any problems with them, but I will update my review once I have done this.
customer_reviews.author: R. Gross

customer_reviews.title: nice stable
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this kayak as a loaner for friends and family. It has been out at lakes and rivers. Not 1 hole yet. Not too bad to maneuver but obviously does not handle as well as our mold kayaks but it is much more stable. In a river it keeps up ok but for long lake trips it is hard to keep up. Set up takes about 5 minutes. With the large valve releases air can be removed in a matter of seconds. Make sure you put in the drain plug before heading out!
customer_reviews.author: antonius

customer_reviews.title: Should have bought one years ago.
customer_reviews.text: There are several well written, lengthy reviews on this product so I'll keep it short. I too was frightened by the word inflatable, but have been completely impressed with this kayak. It's perfect for my 13 y.o. daughter and I, but I have also fished with friends.....we are both over 6 ft and had no issues. 15 min(or less) setup with included pump. Tear down is similar, including drying. I set up/tear down on a tarp to cut down on debris but even when hitting the shore a little too fast I've had not issues with durability. Great value, and I love that I can store it in my closet or backseat. Would absolutely recommend!
customer_reviews.author: HopelessRoguemantic

customer_reviews.title: Super fan kayak for 2 or 1 persons
customer_reviews.text: 1 person fits comfortably 2 not so much but can be done. Harder to get around than on a regular kayak but still all the fun. Inflation is the only annoying part but must be done if you don’t have the proper car to strap down the kayak on inflated.. with the hand pop I recommend inflating it as much as possible so it feels very sturdy for everything to go smoothly on the water and you can maneuver better with a harder surface. It won’t pop as long as you’re not using a machine to inflate.
customer_reviews.author: Denyszzmm

customer_reviews.title: Super Easy and Great Kayak
customer_reviews.text: Easy to inflate (takes less than 10 min), very durable so far (have used around a dozen times with no issues), and comfortable for 2 people. I wouldn't take it out in big waves in the ocean or on an extended kayak trip, but has held up well paddling in freshwater and in saltwater for trips of 3ish miles max. There is enough space for a small cooler and dry bag. The paddles aren't the greatest in the world, but they do the job. The only real con is the bag- the zipper tore after about 5 uses.
customer_reviews.author: Caroline Zahnow

customer_reviews.title: It should’ve  lasted longer than once!!!
customer_reviews.text: Used it the first time and it was great however the second time I used it one side started to deflate while we were on the lake. I bought this inflatable kayak because it is something I can carry and maneuver by myself. My daughter and her boyfriend tried it out first and loved it! (my daughter- 5' and her boyfriend- 5'6"). Then I did it alone and it was the perfect amount of leg room for me (5'2") and room for a small cooler. Granted we are not tall people, but it worked for us. The boat is very sturdy and easy to row. Disappointed, you get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Whale watching!
customer_reviews.text: We put it aside for more than 6 mths and then decided to bring it with us to Mexico. We have an apartment right on the beach, so blew it up and away we went. I'm 6'5" and 250 lbs, my wife, well, not allowed to post, but we are over the maximum. It is not fast, but it works well, especially for the price. Today we ended up less than 100 feet from 3 whales (excluding us 2 in the kayak) What a blast Inflated it 2 weeks ago, or maybe more and it has kept well in 29C degree weather.
customer_reviews.author: KP

customer_reviews.title: Extremely durable very impressed
customer_reviews.text: My brother and I took this little kayak down a fast flowing creek.him and I together exceeded weight limit then we put the kids on our lap. Weight limit is 400 lb with the kids on our lap we were probably 480 lb. We drug bottom of the creek rocks numerous times completely stopping the raft. The rocks are all round River. I was very impressed of the durability. It definitely was not intended to do what we were doing but I am definitely very impressed. The convenience of being able to pump it up and then flatten it at the end makes it very handy for quick trips.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan H.

customer_reviews.title: Great casual kayak!
customer_reviews.text: For the money, this is a fantastic buy! My friends have an inflatable rafts that they take out to listen in on bayside concerts. Now, I don't have the muscles to maneuver a raft down the entrance to the bay we usually use, so when I saw this, I jumped on it. I was surprised how sturdy the kayak seemed as I unpacked it. Inflation is fairly straightforward. I've paddled around the bay one night, casually, and I've also taken it out to relax in the water to watch a concert. It was perfect for both activities. Not sure how well it would work if you're trying to cover some distance, but for casual use, I would recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Lund

customer_reviews.title: Awesome kayak. Bad carrying bag.
customer_reviews.text: For an inflatable kayak I was impressed with both the price and the durability for that price. Super nice rig. I love the kayak! The only thing that boggles my mind is the carrying bag it comes in. This is to help protect it when it’s not in use. That’s very important and this bag does not meet the standards I would have expected with a product like this. Intex dropped the ball big time on that. It needs a better carrying bag that actually doesn’t fall apart the first time you put it back. Zipper sucks too.
customer_reviews.author: mdstry

customer_reviews.title: So much fun I bought another!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is amazing- super easy set up and break down- so much room for 2 people plus an almost 2 year old, a cooler, and a backpack, and the pump just in case. We decided we wanted another bc we have 3 kids so it will be fun for the whole family to get out on the water. I love how the side walls are fairly deep so you don't really get wet if you are in calm enough water. The paddles are not that great so we may upgrade but a 2 person kayak this sturdy for under $100 is an incredible deal. Hoping it will last us a few summers of fun!
customer_reviews.author: Jacqueline

customer_reviews.title: We love these kayaks!
customer_reviews.text: These are great fun! We live on one of the Great Lakes and have used these 5 times since we got them (purchased 2) a week ago. They look narrow when you first blow them up but me and my husband are decent sized people and fit fine. They do come with a manual pump but we use our travel Ryobi battery powered air pump. These are very long kayaks but we fit them blown up In the back of our pickup with the tailgate down and use straps to hold them in the bed. We are extremely happy with our purchase and would recommend these kayaks.
customer_reviews.author: Angela

customer_reviews.title: The worst
customer_reviews.text: How can you sell something that LEAKS air when it relies on AIR to keep you safe?? This is the most ridiculous product I have ever ordered from Amazon. This is a safety hazard and should be taken off the site. DO NOT order this product! Returning this immediately.
customer_reviews.author: John D Deese

customer_reviews.title: Cheap, but could be good.
customer_reviews.text: Ours had a leak on one side. We took it out and after about 45minutes had to come back because of it. It looked low after we inflated it at home, but it had sit in the truck for several days. So we were hoping we didn't seal it / get it full inflated. We filled it back up, but as said, it was going critically flat while on the water. Had to return it, would of been a solid 4 stars not for the leak.
customer_reviews.author: Family Man

customer_reviews.title: Super tough and durable! I love it ! 2 years strong
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had this kayak for 2 years now. I’ve gotten well over 30 uses out of it and it’s still going strong. Actually on my second day using it unfortunately it got caught on a fishing hook that was in the grass. I was so mad . 28 plus uses later turns out that hook never did any damage . I could have sworn it was done for ! But this thing is serious business. Definitely recommend it and I even bought one for my brother In law .
customer_reviews.author: Manny C

customer_reviews.title: So much room!!!
customer_reviews.text: HIGHLY RECOMMEND. This thing has been so amazing. I take it out 1-2 times a week on the lake. The fin is very necessary for steering. I’m 20 weeks pregnant and haul this thing, blow it up, and kayak my toddlers around for hours with ease. Even if this thing ever gets a slow leak, it’s worth spending another $90 for a new one. It’s much better than a plastic kayak. I can fit myself, and 3 kids in this thing.
customer_reviews.author: Madison

customer_reviews.title: Slower but sturdy inflatable canoe.
customer_reviews.text: This seems more similar to a canoe than a hard kayak to me. It's very sturdy on the water. I have two girls, 6 and 4 who can both fit with an adult in this. We use one seat for the paddling adult and remove the other seat, the 4 year old goes up front where she can be monitored and the 6 year old sits behind the paddler. They can move around a bit and put hands in the water without threat of a tip. However this boat is more canoe like and hard to gain speed in with just one paddler. I'd call this an affordable blow up family canoe. We really enjoy this boat.
customer_reviews.author: leeann stenger

customer_reviews.title: Wanted to love it
customer_reviews.text: I bought this last year and was so excited to get it because the reviews made it sound so great. Well, using the oar that comes with it, you will be soaked within the first few minutes. Seats were terrible. The day after it came I went to a local sporting goods store and bought a standard kayak. This is sitting in storage and will probably go in the garbage next time I do a cleanup.
customer_reviews.author: Penny

customer_reviews.title: Best Kayaks ever!!!
customer_reviews.text: The inflator that comes with the kayak is extremely fast only takes a few minutes to fully inflate. I battery operated inflator and the included inflator was surprisingly faster. But you might still want a battery operated inflator to help you suck the air out when you're done to cut your deflation time in half and to ensure you get all the air out. My wife and I never kayak so these were extremely easy for beginner's to assemble and operate. Absolutely amazing. I'm a very critical person and don't hold back criticism but I can't think of any for this kayak. I actually bought 2!!!
customer_reviews.author: Charles Pait

customer_reviews.title: Price constantly fluctuating. Terrible paddles too short.
customer_reviews.text: I am giving giving this a 3 star for two reasons. #1 Why is it that I just bought this 4 days ago for $115 and as I come to write a review the price has dropped to $80.. was I just scammed for $35?!?! #2 the paddle sticks for this are way too short it’s extremely uncomfortable and you have to practically shove your hand into the water with the paddle to actually get it to row. But please do explain to me why the price of this thing keeps fluctuating. I understand the whole “seasonal” thing but just 4 days ago when I purchased it..
customer_reviews.author: Jesus

customer_reviews.title: Hole when opened
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 79 year old dad at Christmas and he was very excited to take it on our lake rental trip this year. When he attempted to blow it up there is a small hole in it on first use. We patched the hole and it didn’t work. I can’t find anywhere to get help with this issue and am very disappointed and frustrated that I bought a gift for him that is useless.
customer_reviews.author: Tracy L.

customer_reviews.title: Meets or surpasses expectations
customer_reviews.text: Know what to expect. This is not like a rigid kayak. First it takes 20-30 minutes to inflate and set up, a comparable amount of time to take down and dry for storage. (Recommend keeping a large microfiber sport towel in the storage bag.) Second, compared to a rigid kayak, it's pretty klunky in the water and is not suitable for anything over Class I or seas over 1 foot. I'd also be especially careful of snags and shallows. However, it stores like a dream, is incredibly easy to transport and inflate, and is amazingly clever. Terrific for the price, especially if you can't store or transport a traditional kayak.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Loads of fun for an unbeatable price!
customer_reviews.text: Week 6 into the quarantine, family needed a way to 'get out' without interacting with others. An inexpensive boat fit the bill, so we chose this one (1 adult and 1 kid at a time). We took it to our neighborhood lake and had a blast! 9 year old son was able to paddle for both of us. I had read that the fin can fall off, so I drilled a hole with the smallest drill bit I had (I think it was 1/16?) and attached with fishing wire to the rope on the side of the kayak. Probably the most family fun for under $100.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Material seems quality but one chamber didn't inflate
customer_reviews.text: Purchased based on reviews and YouTube videos. It seems to be quality material. Easy to inflate. Inflated the kayak and noticed the bottom (yellow) chamber did not inflate. Called Intex and they wanted a piece of the defective area returned to them at my cost or work with Amazon. Does waste your time with Intex deal directly with Amazon. I went online and did a return based on being defective and have a new boat already on the way and have 30 days to return the defective boat. Gave the review a 4 because except for the one chamber not inflating the boat seems solid. I can't wait to try it for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Don

customer_reviews.title: 2 seater with one crappy Very short oar
customer_reviews.text: 2 seater with one crappy Very short oar. Need to ensure the hand pump suction disc is in place otherwise it does nothing. Pump is too small. It take far too long to inflate. I had to buy a car powered pump to pump up most of it. The car pump was the same cost as the kayak. I had to buy 2 regular long oars which cost $85 each. It is bulbous on the sides. It doesn't move very fast. Awkward to maneuver. The only benefit is that it can fit into the trunk of a car. I wish I had spent the same amount of money on a kayak car rack and a kayak with normal length oars.
customer_reviews.author: Lu

customer_reviews.title: Hope you like fixing holes!
customer_reviews.text: I really want to like this boat, because it's a cheap and easy way to get out on the water, and it actually paddles nicely. HOWEVER, I have used it five times and got two punctures. I tried repairing with the included patches, but they don't stick, so you'll need to get some glue to patch it properly. Now, I simply cannot trust it for anything other than splashing around near the shore.
customer_reviews.author: bitsy

customer_reviews.title: Great value! Decent Kayak
customer_reviews.text: I was really curious about this and the price was right. I read the reviews and decided it was worth a try. I was pleasantly surprised with how easy it was to inflate, and of course it was incredibly easy to transport. I am only 5'2" so it was fine for me, but I can't see 2 adults of any size being able to fit comfortably in this. Would work great for a couple of kids. I found it to be susceptible to wind (had to really fight to keep on course) and since it's lightweight and short, not that maneuverable. However, the convenience more than makes up for that. I would definitely recommend this kayak!
customer_reviews.author: S. Miller

customer_reviews.title: Love the independence to boat anywhere
customer_reviews.text: I recently moved to a location with multiple large, calm lakes and I wanted to be able to go on the water alone or with grandchildren. This kayak is perfect. It takes less than 10 minutes to inflate with the included air pump, and about 2 minutes to deflate. The bag containing the kayak, pump, 2 seats, and 2 paddles is heavy but certainly manageable. I let it deflate completely and dry completely before putting it in my trunk for the next adventure! I don't know how resistant it is to punctures -- I'm careful near tree line which is now underwater due to flooding.
customer_reviews.author: Wbd2read

customer_reviews.title: Best Amazon Purchase Ever!
customer_reviews.text: This is one of the best purchases I've ever made! I've used this kayak 3 times now and am so pleased with it. The hand pump works amazingly and the carry bag is so helpful! I can even fit my life vest in the bag. You definitely need to use the fin in the water to maneuver properly, but the kayak has decent room for 2 people. I'm 5'9" and have gone out twice with friends who are similar heights. On the flip-side, I've taken it out by myself and had no problem paddling on my own. It's a great buy and sturdy enough to last awhile (I think). I've already convinced multiple friends to buy Intek kayaks.
customer_reviews.author: Elyse Marie Bradley

customer_reviews.title: Great for Camping
customer_reviews.text: We have used this on large bodies of water. Overall we like it alot. The fact that it is light weight and can be taken on camping trips in the back of the pickup truck with lots of other stuff makes it great for us. Think of this as a small one or two person canoe that can be inflated in less than 15 minutes. Ours came complete with two paddles and a manual air pump. Its easy to lay out, inflate, carry and deflate when done and moving on to next place. Beware though that this is an inflatable with high sides, and can be blown around by the wind.
customer_reviews.author: Dadeo

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for our dogs.
customer_reviews.text: I have two dogs and love this kayak. My son and two friends also ordered one. We take our dogs kayaking. One note: If you lose your skeg, like I did, you can call Intex at (800) 234-6839 and order a replacement for less than $4 plus shipping which was under $9 for everything. All you need is the number on the kayak for the correct part. It is in a rectangle box and starts with CN-. I ordered 3 for about $16. :-)
customer_reviews.author: Hope712

customer_reviews.title: Arrived with 2 punctures!
customer_reviews.text: I didn't even get the chance to unpack the oars! The boat had a 1/2" tear( looked like someone stabbed it with a small knife)..anyhow it was past the 90 day return policy and the help line isn't available during this time, so I figured that I would patch it up with a proper patch kit ($35). Everything looked good, so first sunny day I pumped it up (oars still unpacked )and the other side deflated! I found another albeit smaller puncture..I give up, I wouldn't trust it now anyways..I've never written a review before this!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not perfect, but amazing value
customer_reviews.text: I'm giving this 4 stars because of the value, but there are some peripheral easily correctable issues that would have made it 5: Cons: * The existing paddles are way too short! * The seams on the left and right top are quite sharp, and since the paddles are too short you will likely get some scrapes on your hands/arms Pros: * Cheap * Kayak itself feels solid and performs great * Fastest inflating pump I've ever seen! Tips: * Buy longer paddles * Tape down the upper seams which are sharp * Use the tail fin! It greatly aids maneuverability
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: A lot of work to make go
customer_reviews.text: These are easily inflated, simpler than I thought it would be. But, if you are looking for something that is even semi maneuverable, these aren't it. They sit very low in the water where the seats rest making them hard to paddle. The load is therefore not spread out over the length of the kayak. In our case the plastic insert on the paddle broke on the first outing. If you just want a flotation device to putz around a small lake they will work and are then easily stored. If you want to travel any distance on the water I would not recommend them.
customer_reviews.author: Home Remodeler

customer_reviews.title: Fits 2 adults comfortably! Great price!!!
customer_reviews.text: I love my Intex K2. I’ve owned it for over a year now and it hasn’t let me down at all. Holds air great. Comfortably seats two adult men for casual strolls around our local lakes. Light enough for one person to carry overhead. Easy to pump up but I tend to just leave mine inflated and throw it in the back of the pickup and then store it in my garage. You won’t be disappointed. Don’t let the low price scare you away. This thing exceeded my expectations in every way.
customer_reviews.author: T. Boss

customer_reviews.title: Very low quality! Dont trust your life with it.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this back in 2018 winter for $52 on sale, used only 1-2 times 2019 summer. However 2020 summer I used it for about a dozen times. Two holes emerged from insdie the boat at the bottom where two pieces connected, so it's definitely not me handling issue, it was quality issue. For a mere $52 it's not a bad deal, but with the current price tag of close to $200(2020 summer) I would not buy it. And if do decide to buy one, make sure you always go with a friend. You dont want this thing to lose air right in the middle of a lake. Could be very dangerous!
customer_reviews.author: Lqw

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy and easy to set up
customer_reviews.text: Very sturdy and easy to set up. Before I took it to the lake I did a trial run in my garage. Set up in about 15 min. Learning for the first time. After that it took about 10 min. to inflate at the lake and 5 min to deflate. The material is durable, took my 25lb dog on it with me and covered the floor in a towel, no holes from his paws and jumping around. It packs up nicely in the provided bag.
customer_reviews.author: Marissa

customer_reviews.title: I have dogs!
customer_reviews.text: I kayaked over the summer with my one corgi and a borrowed inflatable kayak. That's when I found out how much he liked adventuring. And how much I loved kayaking. But how fair is it to leave my other three potential adventuring corgis out of the fun of kayaking? So I bought not one, but two inflatable kayaks, forcing my husband to kayak with two of our dogs while I take the others. And my dogs' nails don't puncture the kayaks. Do I think two people can actually fit in the kayak? Yes, it's uncomfortable, but much more enjoyable with two corgis instead. I highly recommend for your dogs' adventuring needs.
customer_reviews.author: J. Horst

customer_reviews.title: Dangerous and uncomfortable kayak
customer_reviews.text: I used this kayak once. There was not enough legroom for two short people. Impossible for people of average height. On the lake we were uncomfortable and then I hear a loud WOOOOOOSH! A leak sprung and air was rushing out. I literally had to put my thumb on the hole until we can safely get to shore. Not sure why this product has such good reviews. Maybe the reviews are fake and paid for. I returned it as fast As I could.
customer_reviews.author: M. huynh

customer_reviews.title: For the price this is amazing
customer_reviews.text: Sat on the bay every evening, and would see a few of these now and then. Looked decent so me and a friend bought one. We've used it maybe 8 times now. For the price, it's fantastic. It comes with a pump that is sufficient. This doesn't need high pressure so it's easy to inflate manually. We get it done in about 15 minutes without rushing. Obviously read the instructions for best care. The only con for this kayak is the paddles. They are a bit short so you have to move your body a lot more in order to keep paddling. Might consider getting new ones. Overall, I recommend this one.
customer_reviews.author: Wakka

customer_reviews.title: Buy this!!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased two of these for my boyfriend and I and they are so amazing! Perfect for us since we don’t have a suv to carry big kayaks. These are easy to inflate and pack up. I would recommend having two people while doing it for a quick inflation but I’ve done it on my own and had no problem. They are sturdy and comfortable. So many people have asked where we got them.
customer_reviews.author: Cheyenne

customer_reviews.title: Simply the BEST inflatable kayak.
customer_reviews.text: I have owned this kayak and have waited a whole year for this review. I Have taken it out to the bay and around small islands in Miami. Multiple times. She’s been to key west about 6 times. Strong, sturdy, the best inflatable kayaks I have owned. Its made of a very think vinyl material, very durable! Make sure you pour some fresh water after each use and dry it well before storing it away!!! That is the key for durability! Also ... the obvious, don’t go over every rock on low waters, don’t drag it on rocks or concrete. Take care of it, and you’ll enjoy this amazing kayak for years to come.
customer_reviews.author: Dashiell

customer_reviews.title: So much better than I thought!
customer_reviews.text: The instructions are very simple. The inflation/assembly process is easy to follow. I was surprised how stable I felt when I first put it in the lake and sat down. Also pretty quick to deflate and fold up. I laid to dry on my deck. The only thing was the grips on the paddles were slippery, but not so terrible that I couldn’t keep my stroke for the most part. I felt like I was gripping it pretty tightly to keep it from spinning around in my hand. The grip issue did not effect my love of this kayak. Can’t wait to go again.
customer_reviews.author: Smyle

customer_reviews.title: Up the creek without a my money!
customer_reviews.text: Very hard to inflate the pump is cheap. The seat moves around and not very sturdy and the oars fall apart. I wouldn't recommend this kayak.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome for the money!
customer_reviews.text: This is my second one, purchased for family whitewater trips. Rocked the class III like a champ, but you should know what you're doing and how to read a river and paddle. Personally I don't think it's good for still water, like lakes. It doesn't track well. But on the waves it's pretty awesome. I expected some river rash after hitting quite a bit of shallow water, even getting stuck on rocks a few times. But, they hold up fantastic. It's light enough for my husband and I to carry and for him to manage himself if needed. I'm super petite and have spaghetti arms, but it's manageable with help.
customer_reviews.author: Leigh

customer_reviews.title: Love it but it has its limitations
customer_reviews.text: It’s inflatable, so your butt is the lowest part of the kayak. With 1 in the kayak, it likes to go in circles. A stiffer floor or an insert for kayak bottom would help loads. Love it because I don’t have room for a real kayak, but keep in mind this is more a kayak-shaped floatie with some kayak functionality than a traditional kayak.
customer_reviews.author: Absent Minded Professor

customer_reviews.title: Ruined
customer_reviews.text: THIS WAS FULFILLED AND SOLD FROM AMAZON BUT IT CAME IN THE PRODUCT BOX AMD NOT AN AMAZON BOX LIKE THE PACKAGES USUALLY DO. THIS COMPLETELY RUINED MY HUSBANDS CHRISTMAS PRESENT AND IM SO UPSET. THIS IS EXTREMELY FRUSTRATING, ESPECIALLY AS A PRIME MEMBER.
customer_reviews.author: nicole a.

customer_reviews.title: Amazingly sturdy and easy to handle!
customer_reviews.text: This is an amazing kayak for the price!! I have two small children and we love to be on the water, this allows me to easily bring both with and they are safe because the sides are high enough they won’t fall out. It’s easy to maneuver both in and out of the water! It’s sturdy and doesn’t wobble or tip when the kids are moving around. It’s super easy to inflate and also deflate for when we are done! I can carry it easily fully inflated. The pump, 2 handles and carrying bag are all included. I may buy another just to have for friends! We love this!!
customer_reviews.author: Brit Konsela

customer_reviews.title: 2nd One, Needed another one!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great inflatable kayak. I have owned one for 3+ years and have done shallow rocky waters and still water lakes. This thing is durable! I trust it. That is why I bought another one for my funs in Florida Area. I recommend it to any one. If you are traveling somewhere and plan to go tubing or kayaking and are going to spend the cost of this kayak in rentals. Just have Amazon ship it to your destination! This thing pays for itself every time 2 people I touch water. I use it tandem with friends. I am 5'10 and friend was 5'11. We were both comfortable!
customer_reviews.author: Christopher

customer_reviews.title: Nice price. Works great.
customer_reviews.text: I love this kayak. Its great if you have a smaller car, or just don't want to have to deal with loading up a kayak everywhere you go. I have used it many times over the summer and it has been fantastic. Now that it is winter, its back in the bag and tucked under my bed. Worked fine for 2 grown men paddling up a river. I do recommend when 2 people are using it to have the paddles set up like canoe paddles, not the double sided kayak style or else the person in front is going to get dripped on the entire time.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Miller

customer_reviews.title: Sweet!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is great for every reason! Easy to carry, unpack and set up. I actually use a rechargeable air pump that you can get on Amazo for around $20. Saves a bit of pumping. Then I finish off with the hand pump to stiffen it up a bit. Moves through the water pretty nice given that it's not a regular kayak. Deflates easy too. Price is right too. If it gets damaged in a year, you've lost nothing. Just buy another one. But there are good videos on YouTube showing how good this thing is. One group of 3 people going down some rapids no problem. Pretty cool setup.
customer_reviews.author: Tobias Collins

customer_reviews.title: Great addition to my fleet
customer_reviews.text: My family got into kayaking and this is a great way to add extra spots when we're all out on the water. Plenty of room for my wife, daughter, and some snacks/drinks. The first time I inflated the chambers in the wrong order and it was very difficult, but once I noticed the numbers by the valves it's been quick and easy. The included pump also does an amazing job filling the boat. Much faster than my electric pump. My hard shell kayaks are much easier to paddle through the water, but it's performance is actually higher than expected.
customer_reviews.author: Spencer

customer_reviews.title: Durable, Easy to Use
customer_reviews.text: So glad I purchased these. I don't have the capability to transport a kayak, so I was super excited to find an inflatable option. These are super heavy duty. It would take something pretty sharp or hard force to make a hole in it. The pump included makes inflating it really easy. I thought it would take a long time, but it's got a lot of oomph and only took a few minutes. Also easy to deflate and not terrible to get back in the bag. Although it's a 2 person kayak, it is more comfortable for one adult. Fine for two smaller adults and definitely for two kids.
customer_reviews.author: JG

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, but took too much time to set up/break down
customer_reviews.text: I never even got to use mine in the water, so take this review as you wish. I wanted to love it so much and I feel like if I was more determined I would have. But for me, the inflation and deflation process was too much to do every single time I wanted to use it. I did a test run of the whole thing at home and both hubby and I were tired after trying to deflate it. It's def a great buy if you are willing to build it back up and break it down Everytime you use it! It seemed super sturdy and solid.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole B

customer_reviews.title: Do not compare with the K2 Challenger
customer_reviews.text: If I didn't also have a K2-Intex Challenger 2 person then I would not be able to compare. The Intex Explorer K2 2 person can not keep up with our fiberglass or even the Challenger. The Challenger is streamline. If you have two of the Explorer kayaks then you will have a great time and not notice. They are both great for easy transport, easy to set up and carry home to dry.
customer_reviews.author: Heather

customer_reviews.title: I love this inflatable kayak!
customer_reviews.text: Pro: Been having my kayak for a while now, I bought 2! Its been shared around the family so much and I bought 2 more as Christmas gifts. It’s way more affordable and transportable than a regular kayak. The durability of the material of the kayak itself is amazing! We enjoy this very much! Cons: When you pull up the pump soo hard overtime, somehow on one of my pumps, it came apart, but were able to put it back together. It was just a bit annoying to keep pumping and keeps coming apart. I had to tell my friend to put ease on it lol.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Great little kayak!! We just take it out on the small local lake to float around in the sun. The pump works great and was pleasantly surprised how quickly I could fill it up, and once blown up, the boat is light enough for me (5ft5 120 lbs woman) to drag a short distance from the car to the dock. The material is very durable, and we enjoyed bringing our 15 lb dog along with us. Would absolutely have put our 30lb dog in with us if she had her own life vest :)
customer_reviews.author: Krista

customer_reviews.title: Great for lakes, but not for 1 small paddler
customer_reviews.text: Bought this last summer and have used it in a very calm lake as well as in a rocky river. As a single, 120lb female, it's definitely more difficult to paddle than your typical hard-sided, single kayak. I had to do double the work of my friends. I think it would work much better with 2ppl to split the work. However, in a mountain stream/small river with rocks just below the surface, we could not clear the rocks with 2ppl in it. I had to solo the river, which turned out to be OK, and easier to control with a current to help me along. I SO wish they made this same version for 1 person!
customer_reviews.author: Lesli Y-M

customer_reviews.title: Okay while it lasted......
customer_reviews.text: For the price it worked well....while it lasted. This was used maybe 5 times and it develop a leak in a weld seam on the floor. If you only want this for a weekend trip or as a pool toy it might be fine. My wife got $60 worth of fun out of it, but ifnyou want something longterm look for something better. It did the job for her and proved it was something she wants to invest more money into. We are now looking for something similar in the $1000-1500 range that will last a few years of weekend use.
customer_reviews.author: Beantown

customer_reviews.title: Missing parts
customer_reviews.text: Hello, i just bought intex kayak explorer K2 and it is missing the in-between black plastic of the oars. For now i cannot use the kayak, it is very frustrating. Please send it to me asap and i will change my review. I tried to contact intex via their website and it was the worst contact form i ever have use, i had to do it 5 times before it seemed to work. I was very easy to inflate with the intex pump, in less than 5 minutes you are ready to go. It seems strong it looks good. Still, without the oars i can not go..
customer_reviews.author: flo le pompier

customer_reviews.title: GOOD PURCHASE
customer_reviews.text: I was a little skeptical about this purchase. once I tried it I was so please to have purchased this inflatable kayak. it is very stable and firm , easy to inflate and dis inflate. I would have gave it a 5 star but I had a problem with the seam that is on top of each side. you have to keep your arms off it when rowing after a while the bottom of my forearms were getting irritated from rubbing on them. if they would have the seam more to the side of the kayak it would be a lot better. other than that I'm happy with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Hector

customer_reviews.title: Great buy
customer_reviews.text: What a great buy this kayak was. My wife and I were headed to our favorite yearly vacation spot and I priced what it would cost to rent a kayak and saw it would be about the same price to buy this one. We really enjoy getting out on the water, rowing, fishing or just plain relaxing. It's easy to inflate. Plenty of room for the both of us and our fishing gear and light enough for the 2 of us to throw in the back of our pick up and travel with. We've had this kayak for 3 years and it looks brand new. I'm glad I thought of this!
customer_reviews.author: MarkMak

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use for recreational kayaking
customer_reviews.text: This was our first venture in kayaking. I didn't want to spend the money for a hard sided kayak just yet, so chose this one based on others' reviews. We were pleasantly surprised at how easy it was to inflate with the included inflation pump. It holds air extremely well. We used it on the Clinch river in VA. The river had some rocky spots, but the kayak had no issues. The seats are easy to adjust too. My husband is 6' and once we got the seat adjusted, there was plenty of room for both of us.
customer_reviews.author: Melody J

customer_reviews.title: 2nd canoe. Keeps breaking.
customer_reviews.text: First one leaked air slowly from bottom. Second one was great. No air leaks. Didn't need to pump for a month. BUT, then the straps holding the back seats started to break. Tried contact warranty service Intex. What a disaster. No telephone response. No response from sending online mail. No way to email. Good thing Amazon is great company with great customer service. DO NOT BUY FROM ANYONE BUT AMAZON. At least then you can return to them. Would have loved to love this boat. Price is right, design is fine. It just doesn't hold up.
customer_reviews.author: PR

product_meta.title: Intex Explorer K2 Kayak, 2-Person Inflatable Kayak Set with Aluminum Oars and High Output Air Pump
product_meta.description: The Intex Explorer K2 Kayak is sporty and fun with a streamlined design for easy paddling. The bright yellow color and sporty graphics makes the kayak highly visible in the water. Great for experiencing lakes and mild rivers with a friend, this Sports Series kayak is perfect for two adults. Lightweight and compact, this kayak is a snap to assemble, and allows you to take the fun of kayaking wherever you go. Made with rugged vinyl construction, this sturdy kayak has an inflatable I-beam floor for comfort and rigidity. A removable skeg provides directional stability, while two adjustable, inflatable seats with backrests are included for comfort. Quick inflating or deflating is a breeze with a Boston valve on each side. A grab line and grab handle at each end is provided for your convenience, as well as a U.S. Coast Guard I.D., and a repair patch kit. The Explorer K2 Kayak provides added accessories including: two 86”aluminum oars and an Intex high-output pump for easy inflation and deflation.
feature_bullets: Comfortable for Anyone: Kayak Includes an Adjustable Inflatable Seat With Backrest; Cockpit Designed for Comfort and Space
Dimensions: Inflated Size 10 Feet 3 X 3 Feet X 1 Feet 8 Inch; Maximum Weight Capacity: 400 Pounds
Directional Stability: Removable SKEG for Directional Stability
Increased Visibility: In Case of Emergency, Bright Yellow Color Helps Visibility
Made for Smaller Bodies of Water: Explorer k2 is Made for Smaller Bodies of Water Including Lakes and Mild Rivers

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
